briefdescription.para: Map ie_page_policy to madvise() flag where possible.

detaileddescription.para: Returns 0 if unsupported (no-op), -1 on hard misuse errors.

briefdescription.para: Apply a memory access policy to a mapped region (best-effort).

detaileddescription.para: Internally attempts madvise() with the nearest matching advice (MADV_NORMAL, MADV_RANDOM, MADV_SEQUENTIAL, MADV_WILLNEED, MADV_DONTNEED). If madvise() is unavailable, the call becomes a no-op.

parameterdescription.para: Base address of the mapped region (page-aligned recommended).
Length in bytes of the region (rounded up by the kernel).

simplesect.para: 0 on success or harmless no-op, -1 on hard error (errno set).

memberdef.argsstring: (int fd, off_t offset, off_t length, ie_page_policy policy)
memberdef.name: ie_mmap_fadvise

briefdescription.para: Provide file-cache hints for a file descriptor (best-effort).

detaileddescription.para: Internally attempts posix_fadvise() with POSIX_FADV_* equivalents. Not all ie_page_policy values have a 1:1 mapping; unsupported ones degrade to a reasonable fallback or a no-op.

parameterdescription.para: Open file descriptor for the mapped file.
Starting byte offset within the file.
Number of bytes to advise (0 may mean "to EOF" on Linux).

simplesect.para: 0 on success or harmless no-op, -1 on hard error (errno set).

briefdescription.para: Suggest Transparent Huge Pages (THP) for a mapped region (best-effort).

detaileddescription.para: Attempts madvise(addr, len, MADV_HUGEPAGE) when available. If enable is 0, attempts MADV_NOHUGEPAGE. If the kernel lacks these flags, this function becomes a no-op and still returns 0.

parameterdescription.para: Size of the region in bytes.
Non-zero to request THP; zero to explicitly disable THP.

simplesect.para: 0 on success or harmless no-op, -1 on hard error (errno set).

briefdescription.para: Try to pre-populate page cache for a file range (best-effort).

detaileddescription.para: On Linux, first tries the readahead(2) system call; if unavailable, falls back to posix_fadvise(..., POSIX_FADV_WILLNEED) as a weaker hint.

parameterdescription.para: Length in bytes; use a reasonable cap (e.g., mapped size).

simplesect.para: 0 on success or harmless no-op, -1 on hard error (errno set).

briefdescription.para: Read the kernel HugeTLB default page size in bytes, if known.

detaileddescription.para: Parses /proc/meminfo line Hugepagesize: on Linux. Returns 0 if unknown.

simplesect.para: HugeTLB page size in bytes, or 0 if not detected.

memberdef.argsstring: (const void *addr, size_t length, size_t stride, uint64_t *checksum)
memberdef.name: ie_mmap_prefault_touch_ro

briefdescription.para: Quick in-place page touching to prefault a region into RSS.

detaileddescription.para: Strides by cache-line (default 64 bytes) to force-demand paging in a bounded manner. Safe for read-only mappings. This is independent from readahead and can be used after mmap() to ensure residency.

parameterdescription.para: Base pointer of the mapped region.
Stride in bytes (use 64 or 128). Zero selects 64.
Optional out pointer to receive a lightweight checksum (may be NULL). Helps compilers keep the loop intact.

simplesect.para: 0 on success; -1 if inputs are invalid.

briefdescription.para: Implementation of portable mmap tuning helpers.

detaileddescription.para: See ie_mmap_tuning.h for the public API and behavioral contract.
